abstract: Small colleges nationwide are struggling financially, forced to re-examine their missions as fewer students graduate high school and parents increasingly question benefits of sending their children to expensive, private schools; many of schools in worst shape are in rural areas, and some are women’s colleges, historically black colleges or religiously affiliated, all schools that appeal to smaller populations.

headline.print_headline: Small Colleges Are Pressured Over Finances
headline.main: At Small Colleges, Harsh Lessons About Cash Flow

keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
keywords.name: subject

snippet: In the last few years, small liberal arts colleges struggling under financial siege have been forced to re-examine their missions and justify their existence.
lead_paragraph: In the last few years, small liberal arts colleges struggling under financial siege have been forced to re-examine their missions and justify their existence.
